intro: Marrubium brachyodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved horehound, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often found in mountainous regions. Its medicinal properties have been historically utilized in traditional herbal remedies. The species is noted for its compact growth habit and drought tolerance.
